metadata.title: CVE-2024-3596 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
RADIUS Protocol under RFC 2865 is susceptible to forgery attacks by a localattacker who can modify any valid Response (Access-Accept, Access-Reject,or Access-Challenge) to any other response using a chosen-prefix collisionattack against MD5 Response Authenticator signature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-3596` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-gss-samples - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-kdc - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-locales - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-multidev - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-otp - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-pkinit - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
krb5-user - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libgssrpc4 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libk5crypto3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkadm5clnt-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkadm5srv-mit8 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkadm5srv-mit9 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkdb5-7 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkrad0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkrb5-3 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
libkrb5support0 - 1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: krb5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12+dfsg-2ubuntu5.4+esm6').
libpam-radius-auth package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
